---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body: @YaelDillies, I think you recently cleaned up some names around here: does this look good to you?

> suffixing with `of_canonicallyOrdered` is not currently a naming convention. The current convention is to put in the `CanonicallyOrderedSomething` namespace.

I have renamed the lemma to `CanonicallyOrderedCommMonoid.single_le_prod`. I don't have strong feelings but I think I still prefer `Finset.single_le_prod_of_canonicallyOrdered` since:

- the related lemmas directly below all live in the `Finset` namespace
- using the suffix `_of_canonicallyOrdered` is generic over the `CanonicallyOrderedCommMonoid`, `CanonicallyOrderedCommSemiring`, ...

I agree, but if you want to change the convention it should be a separate PR.

At any rate, this PR is good now, so

maintainer merge
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8295769113/job/22703488390)

I did not rename these lemmas recently, no. All I can say is that suffixing with `of_canonicallyOrdered` is not currently a naming convention. The current convention is to put in the `CanonicallyOrderedSomething` namespace.

The PR title is outdated.

I did not rename these lemmas recently, no. All I can say is that suffixing with `of_canonicallyOrdered` is not currently a naming convention. The current convention is to put in the `CanonicallyOrderedSomething` namespace.

The PR title is outdated.
Do you want both of those arguments to be explicit?
Good point; I have made `i` implicit.
Arguably this should be renamed to be consistent with [`Finset.single_le_sum`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/BigOperators/Order.html#Finset.single_le_sum)

Agreed, that seems appropriate for discoverability. I have proposed some alternative names in https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/11383/commits/8207488b12655c4bfb7cacf7feb0100f06784343

```suggestion
lemma _root_.Fintype.single_le_prod_of_canonicallyOrdered [Fintype ι] (i : ι) :
```
To match `Fintype.sum_eq_single`

```suggestion
@[to_additive "In a canonically-ordered additive monoid, a sum bounds each of its terms.
```
I would skip that one since we don't have `Fintype.single_le_sum`
Fair enough, I've dropped it.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: add lemma `CanonicallyOrderedCommMonoid.single_le_prod`

nodes.body: @YaelDillies, I think you recently cleaned up some names around here: does this look good to you?

I did not rename these lemmas recently, no. All I can say is that suffixing with `of_canonicallyOrdered` is not currently a naming convention. The current convention is to put in the `CanonicallyOrderedSomething` namespace.

The PR title is outdated.

> suffixing with `of_canonicallyOrdered` is not currently a naming convention. The current convention is to put in the `CanonicallyOrderedSomething` namespace.

I have renamed the lemma to `CanonicallyOrderedCommMonoid.single_le_prod`. I don't have strong feelings but I think I still prefer `Finset.single_le_prod_of_canonicallyOrdered` since:

- the related lemmas directly below all live in the `Finset` namespace
- using the suffix `_of_canonicallyOrdered` is generic over the `CanonicallyOrderedCommMonoid`, `CanonicallyOrderedCommSemiring`, ...

I agree, but if you want to change the convention it should be a separate PR.

At any rate, this PR is good now, so

maintainer merge
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.
